thread.title: Travel Writer Gets A Taste Of Sioux Falls
thread.title_full: Travel Writer Gets A Taste Of Sioux Falls

title: Travel Writer Gets A Taste Of Sioux Falls
text:
Travel Writer Gets A Taste Of Sioux Falls October 21, 2015, 7:11 AM by Brittany Larson SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
For those who live here or are just visiting, they'll find there's no shortage of great places to eat in Sioux Falls. 
"It's the first time here, and it's quite impressive," writer and travel photojounalist Ron Stern said. 
Stern has worked as a photojounalist for the past 16 years and is a city editor for Denver-based Daily Meal. 
"When you have never been here before, I think there are a lot things to see and do that most people don't really realize," Stern said. 
Stern, who's also known as the Global Gumshoe, took advantage of his short visit and stopped by some local favorites. 
"I found that it's quite unusual, a lot of the local flavor and people from different backgrounds and different diversities," Stern said. 
For quality and diversity, he made his way to Sanaa's for an enjoyable experience. 
"She has a loyal following," Stern said. "People love her food and love her personality, and the food is amazingly good." 
Next on his list is Bros Brasserie on Phillips Avenue. Owner and head chef Ryan Tracy appreciates the positive coverage. 
"It's extremely rewarding and makes that hard work in this career. That's really what you want, the recognition. If you can get that, and bring that to your city or state, it's something you can be very proud of," Tracy said. 
Stern enjoyed a tasty enchiladas at Mamma Laddas and dessert at Oh My Cupcakes! He also made stops at CH Patisserie for another sweet treat. 
"Someone like Ron, or any travel writer who has never been here before, the whole scope of Sioux Falls is available to sell to them. To convince them, and to show them. And time and time again, they fall in love with Sioux Falls," Teri Schmidt said. Not only with the city but also those who live here. 
"It seems like the people are very down to earth and very friendly, everyone has been accommodating and kind," Stern said. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
